meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Welcome back to my humble abode of groovy gaming reviews! Today, we're diving into the whimsical world of Paper Trail, a puzzle game that's got everyone folding, sliding, and feeling all the feels. But before I get to the good stuff, let me just say that reviewing games is like trying to fold a perfect paper airplane - it takes skill, patience, and a healthy dose of humor (which, let's be real, I'm all about).

Now, onto the reviews! Metro GameCentral gave Paper Trail a solid 70, praising its charming illustrations and perspective-shifting puzzle game mechanics. Push Square agreed, handing out an 80 for the game's unique puzzle mechanic and sweet coming-of-age tale. PlayStation Universe raved about the game's "clear passion" and mastery of craft, earning it a whopping 95 (I mean, who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned score-bomb?). GameSpew was a bit more lukewarm with its 70, finding the puzzles to be an acquired taste that can grow tiresome. PlayStation Country gave us another 80, praising the game's lovely origami mechanic and expertly crafted levels. Softpedia chipped in with its own 75, highlighting the game's immersive experience and addictive puzzle-solving. And finally, Finger Guns brought up the rear with an 80, declaring Paper Trail a great entry into the puzzle genre.

Now that we've got all those opinions out of the way, let me tell you - I'm here to give you my own take on Paper Trail! As a groovy gaming reviewer, I gotta say that this game is like the indie cousin at the family reunion - it's quirky, charming, and might just surprise you with its hidden talents. The puzzles are cleverly designed, requiring just the right amount of folding and sliding to get those collectibles (because, let's be real, who doesn't love collecting stuff?).

But what really sets Paper Trail apart is its whimsical world-building - it's like stepping into a fairy tale, minus the awkward prince-saves-the-princess bits. The story might not hit all the emotional highs, but it's still an endearing journey that'll have you hooked (pun intended).

All in all, if you're looking for a puzzle game that's a cut above the rest, Paper Trail is definitely worth folding (ahem) into your gaming rotation. So grab some popcorn, sit back, and get ready to slide your way through this enchanting adventure!
